decks.notes: The key concept of the deck is to utilize the Greasefang Parhelion combo to generate value and control the board. The deck focuses on ramping up mana with lands like Shattered Sanctum and Monument to Endurance, while using cards like Guardian of New Benalia and Seasoned Hallowblade for protection. Thoughtseize helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Fatal Push provide removal options. The deck aims to establish a board presence with Greasefang, Okiba Boss and eventually overwhelm the opponent with the powerful Parhelion II.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and maintain control. The deck also includes cards like Supreme Verdict and Field of Ruin to deal with threats on the board. With the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard providing additional value, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent while controlling the game.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and control elements. By using cards like Guardian of New Benalia, Seasoned Hallowblade, and Thoughtseize to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to create an unstoppable force that can quickly close out the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Fatal Push and Sheltered by Ghosts provides additional protection and removal options to ensure the combo can be executed smoothly.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to quickly deal damage and win the game. The deck focuses on a fast and efficient strategy, utilizing cards like Screaming Nemesis, Reckless Rage, and Burst Lightning to control the board and pressure the opponent. With a mix of low-cost creatures and direct damage spells, the deck aims to maintain a high level of aggression throughout the game, ultimately aiming to secure a victory before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruption spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes fast removal like Fatal Push and Abrade to control the board while creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse apply pressure. The deck also includes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while maintaining board control to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive black and red cards that aim to quickly take out the opponent's creatures and life total. It includes powerful disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to apply pressure on the opponent. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive threats and disruptive spells to secure a victory.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck includes powerful creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Sunspine Lynx, as well as efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Kumano Faces Kakkazan provide additional ways to push damage through and disrupt opponents. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a steady stream of damage to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to establish board control and card advantage through countering opponent's spells, removal, and card draw. The deck includes cards like Spell Pierce, Dovin's Veto, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to control the flow of the game, while also utilizing cards like Supreme Verdict and No More Lies for board wipes and disruption. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in longer games. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision making.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to outvalue the opponent by denying them resources and outpacing them in card advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds an additional threat and synergizes well with the deck's game plan. The deck also utilizes a mix of win conditions, such as creature beats from Beza and Hall of Storm Giants, along with alternate win conditions like March of Otherworldly Light. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Aggro strategies to overwhelm opponents with Spirit creatures. It includes cards like Supreme Phantom and Skyclave Apparition to quickly establish a board presence. The deck also includes disruption spells like Spell Queller and Spell Pierce to control the game. The mana base includes lands like Hallowed Fountain and Seachrome Coast to ensure consistent casting of spells. The deck aims to be aggressive, while also maintaining control over the game through a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly and aggressively disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Fatal Push while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Blade of the Oni. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells and close out the game with powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out adds versatility and card advantage to maintain aggression and momentum throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm opponents. By utilizing Monument to Endurance and Sheltered by Ghosts to protect key creatures and generate value, the deck aims to disrupt opponents with Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while setting up its combo pieces. With a mix of land support and creatures with protection, the deck aims to create a resilient board state that can quickly close out games.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cast spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal damage to the opponent. With cards like Artist's Talent, Consider, and Opt to draw cards and find the necessary pieces, along with cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to trigger the Phoenix's return, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays while also maintaining card advantage through Treasure Cruise and other draw effects. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Spikefield Hazard and Picklock Prankster helps to control the board and protect the Phoenix as it swings in for lethal damage.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cheap spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, creating a fast and aggressive strategy. It also includes spells that provide card advantage and help control the board, while utilizing cards like Treasure Cruise and Temporal Trespass to refill the hand late game. The mana base includes lands that support both blue and red spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and recursive threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It uses powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate card advantage and control the board. Cards like Dovin's Veto and Spell Pierce provide interaction against opposing spells, while sweepers like Supreme Verdict and Day of Judgment help reset the board. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide additional value with its enter-the-battlefield ability. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient control elements and card advantage.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Mutavault allows for additional attacking power, while cards like Blightstep Pathway and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provide additional value. Overall, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure to secure a quick victory.
